text:
If building technology that reaches billions excites you, the right skills can take you far.

We‚Äôre looking for engineers that have:
üß© A knack for breaking down hard problems and solving puzzles
üöÄ A scaling mindset (thinking billions, not dozens)
üôå Team energy that pushes ideas across the finish line

Sound like you? Check out our open SWE roles ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3SiDtiz

After eight years in France‚Äôs video game industry and a creative stint running her own sewing business, Han decided to cross the sea for a new chapter at Google Dublin. 

Now a Program Manager on Google‚Äôs Global Infrastructure team, Han helps ensure the network that powers Google runs seamlessly. ‚ÄúI'd like to think of myself as a ‚Äòcaptain‚Äô of a program,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúSteering the ship, making sure every team involved is working together and has what they need to reach a common destination as smoothly as possible. My team specifically delivers WAN capacity, basically allowing Google's network to handle all the data flowing through it across the world.‚Äù

When asked about the one non-negotiable skill needed for her role, Han shares: ‚ÄúDefinitely a ‚Äòsoft skill‚Äô like the ability to lead and influence without authority,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúAs we're at the center of a complex web of teams and stakeholders, it is crucial for us to build cross-functional relationships, motivate team members with vision and empathy!‚Äù

Her favorite part of the Dublin office? The people. ‚ÄúIt is a huge hub of international teammates from all backgrounds and cultures that I find the most interesting.‚Äù

Explore open roles at Google Dublin ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4pxbFpf

Meet David, an Austin-based software engineer at Google. ‚ÄúI work on Google Play, where I focus on all things regarding users‚Äô Play Library,‚Äù he explains.

David was initially drawn to working at Google because of our global reach. ‚ÄúSolving problems for a few thousand users is one thing; having your work affect hundreds of millions ‚Äî sometimes even billions ‚Äî is entirely different,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúAt Google, we get to solve problems at a scale that is massive. This brings its own challenges, but the impact is worth it.‚Äù

Want to make a global impact like David?  Explore our open roles and career opportunities ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4kKGHrd

November ushered in a new era of intelligence: With the launch of Gemini 3, we're improving everyone's ability to learn, plan or just get things done. 

Catch up on Gemini 3, Nano Banana Pro, Google Maps and more in the November edition of our newsletter breaking down all the latest AI updates from Google.

This year, we searched for ways to rediscover, reinvent, and rethink what‚Äôs possible. See how people reimagined their worlds in 2025 in our annual #YearInSearch. 

Explore more top trends from the year ‚Üí yearinsearch.google

As a Product Solutions Consultant on the Google Customer Solutions team (gTech Ads) in Chicago, Rohini is the technical bridge keeping major campaigns on track.

‚ÄúI specialize in Display & Video 360 (DV360), and my core mission is instant, deep-level problem-solving. My priority is clear: minimize advertiser loss, prevent campaign downtime, and protect partner trust.‚Äù

Before joining gTech Ads, Rohini worked hands-on with network infrastructure ‚Äî experience that taught her the importance of stability and thoughtful diagnostics. She now brings that same mindset to DV360.

What makes the role work is turning technical analysis into meaningful business insights. ‚ÄúSuccess requires the ability to quickly translate deeply technical findings‚Äîsuch as a specific bug in a DV360 ‚Äî into clear, concise, and high-level business impacts for non-technical audiences.‚Äù

When it comes to advice, Rohini encourages future PSCs to think beyond a single product. ‚ÄúFirst, master the ecosystem, not just the platform,‚Äù she says. She also emphasizes developing strong Root Cause Analysis habits, building cross-functional empathy and translating technical solutions for different audiences ‚Äî skills that turn technical expertise into real influence at Google. 

Explore Customer Solutions roles at Google ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4pmrmj7

I‚Äôm proud to share that Alphabet Inc. is on TIME's Best Companies for Future Leaders 2026 list. 

This recognition is a testament to every manager and leader who takes the time to coach their teams, every Googler who embraces a growth mindset, and our learning and leadership development teams whose mission it is to make Google the best school anywhere - a place where you can learn about business, leadership, and life in ways you can‚Äôt anywhere else. 

Here‚Äôs to keeping the momentum going and continuing to build a culture where everyone has the opportunity to learn, grow, and thrive.

https://lnkd.in/emJU9vdE

Gemini 3 can now think even deeper üß†

Today, we‚Äôre rolling out an updated Deep Think mode to Google AI Ultra subscribers in the Gemini app. Now, you can take on your most complex challenges backed by the power of Gemini 3 ‚Äî our most intelligent AI model.

How it works: Gemini 3 Deep Think mode uses iterative rounds of reasoning to explore multiple possibilities at the same time ‚Äî much like how a human expert brainstorms different solutions. This approach allows it to excel at complex tasks like math and novel problem-solving that challenge even the most advanced state-of-the-art models.

How to access Gemini 3 Deep Think mode: Today, we‚Äôre rolling out Gemini 3 Deep Think mode to Google AI Ultra subscribers in the Gemini app. Try it out:

1. Go to gemini.google.com
2. Select "Thinking" from the model drop-down
3. Select ‚ÄúDeep Think‚Äù in the prompt bar
4. Submit your task
5. Gemini will let you know when your response is ready!

Learn more about Gemini 3 Deep Think mode ‚Üí goo.gle/4rEayWC

Parth started his Google journey in Austin through an early career program‚Äîand today, he‚Äôs helping startups shape the future from Google‚Äôs NYC office.

As a Customer Engineer on the Startups Customer Engineering team, he partners with early-stage founders to solve problems and scale big ideas. ‚ÄúMy day to day includes getting on calls with startups to discuss project ideas and their goals that our team can assist with,‚Äù he explains.

He loves seeing innovation happen live. ‚ÄúMy favorite thing to do is get in our console and walk through live use cases with our customers to show how easy it is to get started and the immediate results,‚Äù he shares.

The role gives him a front-row seat to entrepreneurship in action. ‚ÄúYou get to meet different startup teams and incredible founders, often playing a pivotal role in their product and feature launches.‚Äù

His advice to others interested in similar roles? ‚ÄúGet creative! My most successful teammates are the ones who approach founders with creative ideas and innovative approaches. Showcasing this side and showing outside of the box thinking is a key part of being at Google.‚Äù

Check out open Customer Engineering roles at Google ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4ihXd29

At Google‚Äôs NYC office, Sarah works at the intersection of storytelling, technology, and public impact as an External Communications Manager. Her role spans media outreach, PR campaigns, spokesperson work and helping audiences make sense of Google‚Äôs innovations.

In her words, ‚ÄúMy core role is securing media coverage for Google's biggest initiatives and acting as an on-air spokesperson to communicate the value of our products directly to audiences.‚Äù

Sarah‚Äôs days move quickly ‚Äî from new product roadmap discussions to national TV appearances. ‚ÄúMy day requires constant context switching: One hour I might be focused on AI safety strategy, and the next I'm prepping for a TV spot on the latest Search trends, " she says.

For anyone interested in communications, Sarah says one capability is essential: ‚ÄúThe most important skill is the ability to translate complex technology into useful, digestible information. You have to understand the technical 'magic,' anticipate the audience's questions, and distill it all into a clear, public message.‚Äù

Above all, she‚Äôs driven by purpose. ‚ÄúI love that my job allows me to be a voice for technology that helps people. I‚Äôm not just pitching a product; I‚Äôm telling a story about people receiving emergency information for a major crisis, the small business owner using Google Maps, or the doctors leveraging AI for early disease detection. That sense of purpose is what makes Google the best place to build a career.‚Äù

Interested in communications careers at Google? Learn more ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3K1AVVo

Meet Alexandra-Irina, a Bucharest-based software engineer on Google‚Äôs Health Platform Infrastructure team. In Alexandra‚Äôs words, her path to Google was ‚Äúa journey defined by overcoming self-doubt and embracing opportunity.‚Äù 

During Alexandra‚Äôs first year of university, a classmate encouraged her to apply to one of Google‚Äôs student internship programs. ‚ÄúHonestly, I didn't believe I would be accepted,‚Äù she shared. ‚ÄúBut I ultimately decided to apply, concluding that I had nothing to lose. That single decision was pivotal.‚Äù During her internship, Alexandra received mentorship, guidance, and ‚Äúinsight into real-world software development‚Äù ‚Äî bridging the gap between academic theory and professional practice. She returned to Google the following summer, and today works as a backend engineer building secure and accessible systems that impact millions of users.

One of the lessons Alexandra learned is that soft skills, such as effective team communication, are just as important as technical contributions. Adaptability ‚Äî  ‚Äúbeing open to constantly learning, embracing change and adjusting your ways of working according to the needs of the team‚Äù ‚Äî is equally vital. And ultimately, Alexandra advises all aspiring Googlers to believe in themselves. ‚ÄúDare to apply and pursue the opportunities that intimidate you.‚Äù

Explore our open roles and career opportunities ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4kKGHrd

Bolands Mills, our regeneration of 150-year-old flour mills in Dublin‚Äôs Docklands, is now open as a place for community, culture and creativity. It‚Äôs a hub for the 1,000+ engineers based at Google Ireland, plus a marketplace for local businesses, a cultural space and much more. Take a tour¬†‚Üì

Gemini 3 is now in the Gemini app. That means new experiments that make your responses more visual and interactive, plus Gemini Agent, a tool available to Google AI Ultra subscribers in the U.S. that can complete multi-step tasks from start to finish, while keeping you in control. See what‚Äôs new with these 3 prompts:

Meet Raquel, a product manager on the Google Maps team. ‚ÄúWhen I was in college, I thought I was going to be a software engineer,‚Äù Raquel explained. ‚ÄúBut I also wanted to work on product strategy and design.‚Äù To explore these career interests, Raquel joined Google as an Associate Product Management (APM) intern. She returned full-time the next year, completing two year-long rotations on the Search and Fonts teams (and a stint at YouTube) before moving full-time to Maps.

Now on Maps‚Äô Spatial AI team, Raquel uses AI & ML to create better digital mapping technology. ‚ÄúI work with various teams to set the product vision & strategy, understand user needs and feedback, and develop the roadmap for new features.‚Äù For Raquel, working on high impact products with a range of partners was a major benefit of working here. ‚ÄúThe global reach, wide variety of teams, and opportunity to improve products I use every day make Google a really exciting place to work. Plus, it‚Äôs great to collaborate with people from all sorts of backgrounds and domains of expertise.‚Äù

Explore our open roles and opportunities ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4kKGHrd

Take a peek inside our new Taipei office, our largest AI infrastructure hardware engineering hub outside of the U.S. 
Learn more ‚Üí https://goo.gle/49HWPrh

What does it mean to be an ‚ÄúAI-first‚Äù company? Last week, CEO Sundar  Pichai talked all things AI, Gemini and development strategy with Logan Kilpatrick on the latest episode of our Release Notes podcast ‚Üí https://goo.gle/482TC4r
Gemini 3 is now in Search, starting with AI Mode. Find out how it works ‚Äî and how it can help you learn more easily than ever ‚Äî from Googlers who helped to build it.
Gemini 3 can help you learn anything, build anything and plan anything. Get started with 15 examples of what our most intelligent model can help you do ‚Üì

Nano Banana Pro (Gemini 3 Pro Image) is our most advanced model to date, allowing you to refine studio-quality results with advanced creative controls.
Get started with these prompting tips and examples¬†‚Üì
We‚Äôve compiled the must-read LinkedIn posts from Googlers leading the teams who launched Gemini 3 and Nano Banana Pro (Gemini 3 Pro Image). Get the latest ‚Üì

Gemini Drops are our regular update on what‚Äôs new in the Gemini app. Here's a look at the latest features this month, from our newest models Gemini 3 and Nano Banana Pro, to Deep Research, which can draw on context from your Gmail, Drive and Chat and work it directly into your research and more.

Spam, malware, phishing emails ‚Äî it can be difficult to stay safe online. In her role as a Product Manager on the User Protection team in Brazil, Googler Rebeca‚Äôs job is to ensure people‚Äôs safety when using our products. ‚ÄúMy focus is on solving common abuse types in Google products, at scale,‚Äù she explains. "My core work involves partnering with the teams behind Google products like Maps, Blogger, and Messages. I focus on two key areas: driving adoption, to ensure as many products as possible are protected by our safety platform, and expanding coverage, to make sure we can solve for the most common types of abuse they face."

This type of work requires constant strategic adjustment. "Adaptability is crucial,‚Äù Rebeca shares. ‚ÄúThe scale at Google means new data, new user trends, and new technologies emerge constantly. Being able to quickly learn and adjust your strategy is essential to keeping up and staying effective."

The power of her team's mission has also fueled her personal growth when it came to her fear of public speaking ‚Äî giving her the courage to speak at an internal conference. "Even though I had been working on it during my career, it was at Google that I had a turning point when I realized that the mission of our User Protection work, and the message that came with it, was bigger than my fear."

Rebeca‚Äôs advice for those interested in similar roles? "If you are passionate about building products, Google gives you the opportunity to apply your skills at an unimaginable scale. The work you do here can genuinely impact the daily experience of billions of users."

Explore open roles at Google Brazil ‚Üí https://goo.gle/49byhGG

Welcome to the Gemini 3 era ‚ö°

Tulsee Doshi, Senior Director of Product Management for Gemini, breaks down the latest on our latest models Gemini 3 and Nano Banana Pro ‚¨áÔ∏è

As a part of the International Accounting and Reporting team, Googler Tejal‚Äôs diverse experience allows her to manage complex deliverables across the Europe, Middle East and Africa region. 

‚ÄúMy career path, including my accounting background, has provided me with a set of unique skills that I apply in my current role,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúWhile I've held various positions, each one has contributed to my knowledge and ability to deliver effectively.‚Äù 

Day-to-day, she manages centralized deliverables for the EMEA region, collaborating with both internal and external stakeholders. Her role involves leading the International Accounting and Reporting deliverables, governance, and escalations across EMEA, driving both project management and continuous process innovation.

‚ÄúGoogle operates on a fundamentally different and more dynamic level than other organizations I've worked with,‚Äù Tejal says. ‚ÄúIt is more than just a job; it is a space where ideas are limitless, continuous innovation is the norm, and work satisfaction is high due to the focus on efficiency and challenging the status quo every day. I've found satisfaction in challenging work that involves both innovation and efficiency. My experience lies in bringing new ideas to fruition, optimizing processes, and enhancing overall performance.‚Äù

Ready to redefine your career path? Explore opportunities at Google ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3Ebyc8z

Join us live from Mountain View for a demo of Nano Banana Pro with Googlers Logan Kilpatrick, Naina Raisinghani, Bea Alessio, Nicole Brichtova, Kat Kampf and more guests. We‚Äôll showcase the latest capabilities in AI Studio, demonstrating how you can master next-gen image generation and editing. Tune in ‚Üì

Introducing Nano Banana Pro (Gemini 3 Pro Image), our new state-of-the-art image generation and editing model from Google DeepMind. It improves on the original model while adding new advanced capabilities, enhanced world knowledge and text rendering, allowing you to create and edit studio-quality, production-ready visuals. 

We‚Äôre also making it easier for everyone to verify if an image was created or edited with Google AI with SynthID, our digital watermarking technology, right in the Gemini app. Simply upload an image to the Gemini app and ask if it was generated with Google AI. 

Get started with Nano Banana Pro ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3K537qo
Learn more about SynthID ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4863IAl

Google DeepMind is opening a new AI research lab in Singapore. This builds on our longstanding commitment to the Asia-Pacific region, and follows a more-than doubling of Google DeepMind's APAC team over the past year. The team will focus on pioneering foundational research in regional languages, advancing Gemini's core capabilities, and applying the latest models across Google products and for Google Cloud customers.

Our new research lab will also work directly with government, businesses, civil society and world-class academic institutions across the region. Learn more about the new Google DeepMind research lab in Singapore. https://goo.gle/49oVZzD

items.title: Google DeepMind opens Singapore research lab for Asia-Pacific AI.

text:
Gemini 3, our most intelligent model, is now available for developers.¬†
Its advanced coding capabilities enable new agentic experiences and rapid app development for everyone.

We‚Äôre also introducing Google Antigravity, a new agentic development platform that changes how you build, shifting the focus from managing individual actions to managing higher-level tasks. It unlocks a new level of developer autonomy, letting you act as the architect, collaborating with intelligent agents that can plan and execute everything from end-to-end coding tasks to generating reports.
¬†
Google Antigravity is available in public preview at no charge on MacOS, Windows and Linux. Try it today ‚Üí antigravity.google

Take a closer look at what Gemini 3 means for developers ‚Üí https://goo.gle/49ro2hU

Logan Kilpatrick, Ammaar Reshi, Kat Kampf and Tulsee Doshi other guests are here to show how you can bring any idea to life with Gemini 3 in AI Studio. 

They'll vibe code apps live to showcase various functionalities and features of AI Studio's Build tab. Tune in now ‚Üì

Introducing Gemini 3 ‚Äî our most intelligent model that helps you bring any idea to life. 

Gemini 3 is our next step on the path toward AGI and has:
üß† State-of-the-art reasoning¬†
üñºÔ∏è Deep multimodal understanding¬†
üíª Powerful vibe coding so you can go from prompt to app in one shot
ü§ù Improved agentic capabilities, so it can get things done on your behalf, at your direction

We're making Gemini 3 Pro available across Gemini App, Search (starting with AI Mode), and our developer products, so you can use its incredible reasoning powers in your daily life ‚Äî to learn, build and plan anything.

Learn more about the Gemini 3 era ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4pfdbvZ 
Read more from Sundar Pichai ‚Üì
New AI updates make editing, creating and searching in Google Photos easier than ever. Here are four new features to try¬†‚Üì

Today, Google DeepMind and Google Research are introducing WeatherNext 2, our most advanced and efficient forecasting model. WeatherNext 2 can generate forecasts 8x faster and with resolution up to 1 hour. Using this technology, we‚Äôve already supported weather agencies in making decisions based on a range of scenarios, helpful for making more accurate forecasts.

Now we‚Äôre taking this research out of the lab and putting it into the hands of users:¬†
- WeatherNext 2's forecast data is now available in Earth Engine and BigQuery.¬†
- We‚Äôre launching an early access program on Google Cloud‚Äôs Vertex AI platform.¬†
- We're using WeatherNext technology to upgrade weather forecasts in Search, Gemini, Pixel Weather and Google Maps Platform‚Äôs Weather API.¬†
- In the coming weeks, it will also help power weather information in Google Maps. 

Learn more. https://goo.gle/487gXAL

items.title: WeatherNext 2: Our most advanced weather forecasting model

text:
Thinking about an Account Manager role at Google? We're hiring and looking for future leaders who are ready to become trusted partners. ü§ù
Our account management roles are built on:
‚úÖ Communication & Trust: Mastering stakeholder engagement, effective meeting management and adaptive communication.
‚úÖ Strategic Insight: Developing deep business understanding and sharp opportunity/pipeline management to drive growth.
‚úÖ Customer Solutions: Delivering innovative solutions and superior customer engagement.
Apply now ‚Üí  https://goo.gle/4lMY7Vg

Today at an event in Texas, we announced a new $40 billion investment in the state through 2027 This funding will help build new cloud and AI infrastructure, including new data center campuses in Armstrong and Haskell Counties. It also includes a new $30 million Energy Impact Fund to scale and accelerate energy initiatives throughout Texas over the next three years, starting in 2026.

To help develop the labor force to build this new infrastructure, electrical training ALLIANCE, with support from the Google.org AI Opportunity Fund, will train existing electrical workers and 1,700+ apprentices in Texas by 2030, more than doubling the projected pipeline of new electricians in the state.

Learn more about our investment in Texas. https://goo.gle/3XwR4oU

items.title: Google‚Äôs investments run deep in the heart of Texas.

text: There are a lot of myths about AI and recruiting. At Google, our recruiting team uses AI technology as a learning tool and to improve candidate experience ‚Äî but our recruiters are the heart of our hiring process, and they remain involved at every step of the journey. VP of Recruiting Brian Ong shares more ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3LzonoM

items.title: How Google recruiters are using and experimenting with AI tools

text:
When I‚Äôm asking friends, family, or a store associate for fashion ideas, I don‚Äôt just say: ‚Äúwork bag.‚Äù¬† Instead I say what I‚Äôm *really* after, like: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm looking for a black leather work bag that‚Äôs comfortable, fits my laptop, and is appropriate for customer meetings.‚Äù üíº

Now with AI, technology is finally catching up to how we actually shop!¬† At Google, we're leading this shift with AI that‚Äôs both conversational and agentic ‚Äì meaning you can say what you want and then it‚Äôll help you buy it: 

‚Üí Conversational: You can ask a shopping question in AI Mode (and follow up conversationally to refine), and get an AI-organized response that brings together rich visuals and all the details you need (like price, reviews, and inventory info). 

And we‚Äôre also bringing new shopping features to the Gemini app!

Put another way, welcome to the era of "vibe shopping" :)

‚Üí Agentic: Our agentic AI can call nearby businesses to check on products (like if the store has what you‚Äôre looking for in-stock) and promotions.¬† 

And with agentic checkout, Google can track an item‚Äôs price and when the price drops for eligible merchants, you can give Google permission to complete the purchase for you. 

These updates are designed to support a thriving ecommerce ecosystem.¬† Shoppers get to delegate the tedious parts of online shopping (but keep the fun and control!), and merchants can capture high-intent sales that might have otherwise been abandoned. 

It‚Äôs pretty awesome to see advancements like these even change my own shopping behavior.¬† This is the bag I ended up getting‚Ä¶ with a very cute model, our cat Paris :) 

Great insights on Google‚Äôs shopping AI transformation from The Verge: https://lnkd.in/gxCKcGDQ

Today we shared our latest advancements in AI and agentic technology in a major AI shopping update across Google. Now you‚Äôll be able to:

-Shop conversationally in Search with AI Mode
-Get shoppable results directly in the Gemini app
-Let Google call nearby stores on your behalf to confirm if they have what you‚Äôre looking for in stock
-And use agentic checkout to track items, and with your permission let Google Pay securely purchase them from eligible retailers in the U.S. on your behalf

These updates bring together the latest Gemini models with our Shopping Graph to make shopping more helpful. Learn more from Vidhya Srinivasan, VP of Ads and Commerce ‚¨áÔ∏è

Doodle for Google is back for the 17th year for K-12 students in the U.S. This year‚Äôs judges, including NBA All-Star Giannis Antetokounmpo, will evaluate submissions around the theme ‚ÄúMy superpower is‚Ä¶‚Äù and the winners will have their artwork on the Google homepage. üé®

Entries are open until December 10. Learn more about this year‚Äôs contest ‚Üí  https://goo.gle/4i48vqC

That text message you got about a "stuck package" or an "unpaid road toll"? It's not just annoying spam. It's the calling card of a sophisticated, global scam that has already swindled victims out of millions of dollars. Protecting you is always our priority. Today, we're sharing the bold steps we're taking to fight back against these criminals. We're filing litigation to completely dismantle "Lighthouse," a massive "Phishing-as-a-Service" operation that has harmed more than 1 million global victims. We are also endorsing bipartisan bills in the U.S. Congress to protect everyone from scams. Learn more from Google‚Äôs General Counsel Halimah DeLaine  Prado.

Starting today, fully autonomous freeway rides will begin to roll out across LA, PHX, and our expanded SF Bay Area territory for select riders. Express interest in the Waymo app to be one of the first in the world to relax on the freeway, with no one behind the wheel. Learn more: https://lnkd.in/gKAc7ri5

This year, over 9,500 participants at 51 Google offices laced up their sneakers and hit the road to run, walk and connect with colleagues in our Google Global 5k, an annual challenge that brings together thousands of Googlers around the world. üëü Thanks to everyone who helped make this event such a success! #LifeAtGoogle

Last week, Ayushe ‚Äî a Sunnyvale-based software engineer ‚Äî led a workshop at #GHC25 focused on how you can build and use retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) to improve the accuracy of large language models. 

Interested in doing similar work at Google? Explore our open roles and opportunities ‚Üí g.co/jobs/GHC

Google Maps just got a big AI upgrade that makes navigating smarter and easier, including a Gemini-powered hands-free conversational experience. It's like having a knowledgeable friend in the passenger seat who can confidently help you get where you‚Äôre going. 

Explore 4 of the new features coming to Maps ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3JRsAn8

Today at the AI Business Summit in Oklahoma City, we announced that we‚Äôre¬† joining forces with the Oklahoma City Thunder to accelerate AI in Oklahoma.

This includes a $5 million commitment to equip Oklahoma students and the local workforce with critical AI and job-ready skills. Google.org will provide the support to leading organizations across the state, including the Thunder Community Foundation, Oklahoma State University Foundation, the Center for Employment Opportunities, Atlas School, and Tulsa Regional STEM Alliance. This support builds on the investments Google is making in Oklahoma. Learn more. https://goo.gle/4hMaJL7

items.title: Google is investing in Oklahoma‚Äôs workforce and talent pipeline.

text:
Today, we published a paper, ‚ÄúAI and the Future of Learning,‚Äù outlining Google‚Äôs approach to building AI to help improve learning outcomes for everyone. Here are 5 takeaways:

1) AI has the potential to reduce barriers to education and unlock human potential.¬†
2) This transformation hinges on paying attention to how people learn ‚Äî the science of learning.
3) That‚Äôs why Google‚Äôs tools for learning are grounded in best-in-class learning science, and the AI models that power them are rooted in pedagogical principles.
4) Realizing the promise of AI in education demands collaborative efforts among technology companies, educators, policymakers, and learners.¬†
5) To navigate challenges like academic integrity, we must equip educators and students with the AI literacy needed to use these tools most beneficially.

We‚Äôll be sharing more insights from our paper over the coming weeks. Read more ‚Üí https://goo.gle/47YuXhc

items.title: AI and learning: A new chapter for students and educators

text:
The new, AI-powered Google Finance is built to help you make sense of the financial world. You can ask questions about the markets and get a helpful AI response, perform technical analysis with advanced charting tools and track the latest news and headlines all in real time.

Now, Google Finance is getting even more powerful upgrades, including Deep Search capabilities, access to prediction markets data and the ability to track corporate earnings. Plus, we‚Äôre rolling out the new Google Finance in India, our first expansion beyond the U.S. Learn more about our newest features. https://goo.gle/4hIz306

items.title: Google Finance adds AI features for research, earnings and more

text:
Now, Gemini‚Äôs Deep Research can pull in info from Gmail, Google Drive and Chat when you connect your Google Workspace account to give you more context-aware reports. 

To try it, just select ‚ÄúDeep Research‚Äù in Gemini on desktop and choose your sources. Coming to mobile soon. Give it a go at https://lnkd.in/gEDFyuk2

The field of Data Center Operations is constantly evolving. That‚Äôs why our DCOps teams champion continuous learning, gaining hands-on experience and contributing across critical functions, from Electrical to Mechanical to Controls.

Want to learn more about working in Google data centers? Johan, a Data Center Operations Facility Manager at our GRQ Data Center in the Netherlands, shares more details ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4qHBZhW

Want to keep up with all the AI news coming out of Google? We've got you covered. 

Here‚Äôs a recap of some of our biggest AI updates from October, including Gemini Enterprise, an AI model to accelerate cancer research and a big quantum computing breakthrough. 

This is the first edition of a new newsletter breaking down our most important updates and insights, all in one place.
Google is #2 on the Forbes list of the Best Employers for Veterans. Read more in this interview with Karen Dahut, CEO of Google Public Sector.

We've teamed up with Girl Scouts of the USA to launch the Be Internet Awesome Family Challenge.

Made possible by Google.Org, this program helps girls and their families navigate the internet with kindness and confidence, fostering a healthy relationship with technology for the next generation of innovators. Girl Scouts who complete the activities can also earn the new ‚ÄúBe Internet Awesome‚Äù Fun patch. Learn more from Ruth Porat, President and Chief Investment Officer of Alphabet and Google.

For over two decades, we‚Äôve been researching what makes a great manager. Now, we‚Äôre sharing what we‚Äôve learned in a new course from The Google School for Leaders. It‚Äôs designed for new and aspiring managers who want to build the confidence and skills to lead effective, high-performing teams. Get started today¬†‚Üì

Aleksandra‚Äôs journey to Google Krak√≥w started years ago, when she was just a student. ‚ÄúAs a part of a scholarship, I got an opportunity to visit the Google office in London, meet amazing women from different countries, and get great support from Google for organizing different events to popularize STEM in my local community,‚Äù she shares. ‚ÄúI joined Google Developer Groups Wroc≈Çaw, and organized multiple tech-related events. I had a chance to visit the Google Wroc≈Çaw office and work with amazing Wroglers (Googlers from Wroc≈Çaw).‚Äù

Now, Aleksandra is a Software Engineer on the RCS (Rich Communication Services) for Business team, which is working to replace traditional SMS with a richer communication protocol.  

‚ÄúMy team works to provide our users with a pleasant, robust and safe experience when communicating with their favorite businesses,‚Äù she explains. ‚ÄúI take care of the Android app (Google Messages) part of the process. I develop various features for the app, but also create design documents, write tests, answer partner questions and sometimes fight the bugs.‚Äù

She finds efficient communication to be one of the most crucial parts of her job: ‚ÄúOur team is based half in Krak√≥w and half in San Jose, California. We also operate closely with the teams from Zurich and Hyderabad. This requires you to communicate with many people across many time zones, and to do it efficiently,‚Äù she says.

Aleksandra credits her career path to taking a chance on community involvement. ‚ÄúI would definitely be in a different place right now if I didn‚Äôt dare to apply for that scholarship or to join Google Developers Group,‚Äù she says.

Explore Software Engineer roles at Google to start a career like Aleksandra‚Äôs ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4mKMRs2

It's officially the most paws-itively spooky time of year, and we‚Äôre celebrating Halloween with the stars of the show: our beloved Dooglers! üß°üñ§ The energy is high today with so many furr-ocious and funny costumes. It's safe to say the trick-or-treating (mostly treating, let's be honest) is a huge success. üê∂üéÉ

Which Doogler brought the ultimate Halloween spirit? Let us know! üëá

Did you know #Gemini for Education is the free, data-protected version of Gemini built specifically for schools? Powered by our 2.5 Pro model, it‚Äôs recognized as the world's leading learning model. Learn more ‚¨áÔ∏è

‚ú® Free of charge - Gemini for Education is available free of charge for all qualifying education institutions.

üîê Private and secure - Your data is not reviewed by anyone or used to train AI models, used for advertising, or shared with third parties. Gemini for Education supports compliance with FERPA and COPPA, and is covered under your Workspace for Education terms.

üéì Purpose-built for learning - Powered by #LearnLM, Gemini 2.5 Pro is the world's leading model for learning. Experts prefer it over GPT-4o by an average of 31% across diverse learning scenarios.

‚òëÔ∏è Powered by our most capable model - Gemini for Education provides expanded access to Gemini 2.5 Pro, our most capable AI model, which leads across a number of industry benchmarks.

üè´ Additional protections for users under 18 - Users under 18 get specific safeguards, including stricter content policies and an AI literacy onboarding experience to help them use the tool responsibly.

Ready to bring Gemini to your school? Check out this link for more ‚û°Ô∏è goo.gle/432WknH

Through a partnership with Reliance Intelligence, we're giving millions of Reliance Jio users access to the Google AI Pro plan at no extra cost for 18 months. Learn more from Shekar Khosla, VP Marketing at Google India.

Are you an experienced leader with a proven track record who thrives on leading projects, inspiring teams and making a real impact? If this sounds like you, explore our open manager roles on the engineering, YouTube, and Google Cloud teams and more.

As a manager at Google, you'll use your experience in project management, technical leadership and people management to lead cross-functional projects. You‚Äôll be a member of a collaborative team, taking ownership of project lifecycles and shifting between detailed analysis and strategic thinking. 

Ready to lead with us? Apply today ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4gp1sYM
On today's 2025 Q3 earnings call, our CEO Sundar Pichai shared that we delivered our first $100 billion quarter. He also highlighted how AI is driving real business results across the company.

Aashna, a software engineer at Google, walked us through her path from intern to full time Googler. 

Explore our open roles and opportunities for students and early career professionals ‚Üí  https://goo.gle/3L37AKu

Today, we're introducing the AI for Math Initiative, supported by Google DeepMind and Google.org. It brings together five of the world's most prestigious research institutions to pioneer the use of AI in mathematical research.

The inaugural partner institutions are:¬†
-Imperial College London
-Institute for Advanced Study
-Institut des Hautes √âtudes Scientifiques - IHES
-Simons Institute for the Theory of Computing
-Tata Institute of Fundamental Research

These partner institutions will work towards the shared goals of identifying the next generation of mathematical problems ripe for AI-driven insights, building the infrastructure and tools to power these advances and, ultimately, accelerating the pace of discovery. We hope this new initiative can explore how AI can accelerate discovery in mathematical research, and tackle harder problems. Learn more. http://goo.gle/3J8u9gn

items.title: Accelerating discovery with the AI for Math Initiative

text:
It‚Äôs an honor to be recognized by Forbes again this year as a top employer for engineers in America! Every day I‚Äôm blown away by our engineering teams. From building cutting-edge AI to groundbreaking research, they're creating helpful products for billions of users around the world. 

From Forbes: 

‚ÄúWhen new hires join Google, they typically don‚Äôt ramp up through a tedious onboarding process. Instead, they dive right in, placed directly into their teams with access to AI-based onboarding programs and a chatbot trained on Google‚Äôs own code and documentation.

The result: ‚Äòa high-performing workplace culture that attracts and retains curious, talented and passionate people,‚Äô says Jen Fitzpatrick, senior vice president of core systems and experiences at Google.‚Äù

Read the whole article here:¬†https://lnkd.in/ezSyG-SD

items.title: Meet America‚Äôs Best Employers For Engineers 2026

text:
New Gemini Drops just dropped!

Create richer videos with Veo 3.1, generate slides in Canvas, get personalized recommendations on Google TV, and more.

Catch up on all the latest Gemini news from this month.

We announced a collaboration with NextEra Energy to accelerate nuclear deployment across the U.S., including the restart of the Duane Arnold Energy Center in Iowa. Through this agreement, we‚Äôre enabling the investment to restart the plant and covering costs for the production of energy from Duane Arnold.

We expect Duane Arnold to be back online in early 2029, and the plant will provide more than 600 MW of clean and safe nuclear energy to the regional grid. This will support our growing cloud and AI infrastructure in Iowa and bring thousands of jobs and substantial economic benefits to the state. Learn more ‚Üí http://goo.gle/4qw1wKB

Each morning, Software Developer Abhigya gets a head start on his day on the GBus from Toronto to Google Kitchener-Waterloo, where he charts the course for the next generation of smart home technology on the Google Home Platform Developer Experience team.

Once he arrives, Abhigya starts each morning with a quick planning session to scope out the work for the day. "As a Software Developer, my core responsibility is to bring the high level ideas and vision for Google Home Platform‚Äôs Developer Console to life by writing code,‚Äù he explains. ‚ÄúMost of my time is spent developing new features for the Developer Console, fixing bugs, and making sure our codebase is healthy and maintainable.‚Äù

But developing complex smart home technology is a team effort, and Abhigya credits the office culture for making innovation possible. "You are also encouraged to ask questions and to collaborate, which makes the exchange of ideas and experiences extremely easy, he says. ‚ÄúI believe this makes the environment extremely conducive to professional and personal growth.‚Äù 

Ready to join the collaborative environment at Google Kitchener-Waterloo? Discover opportunities today ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4hphli0
This week at Google, we announced a major breakthrough in quantum computing. Here are three things to know.

Over the past two weeks, we've seen a flurry of new results from Google Research, from genomics to quantum computing to geospatial understanding.

These breakthroughs exemplify what I call the ‚Äúmagic cycle‚Äù of research: addressing global challenges and opportunities with foundational research that leads directly to real-world applications and solutions. These solutions not only benefit millions around the world, but they also uncover more important problems to solve.

Research is our chance‚Äîand imperative‚Äîto improve day-to-day lives, and address societal challenges and opportunities, and it means that research and innovation is never 'done.' 

Three highlights on latest from Google Research in collaboration with other teams:

‚ú® Fighting Cancer with AI¬†
Our decade-long effort in genomics led to DeepSomatic, an AI-powered tool that accurately spots genetic variants in cancer cells. Our partners used it to identify 10 new genetic variants in childhood leukemia samples that were missed by previous techniques, advancing personalized treatment. Separately, the Cell2Sentence-Scale 27B model successfully generated a novel, validated hypothesis for a combination cancer therapy.

‚ú® Verifiable Quantum Advantage¬†
We demonstrated the Quantum Echoes algorithm on our Willow chip. This marks the world's first verifiable quantum algorithm that brings us a step closer to practical applications of quantum computing, such as designing better materials and medicines, by more precisely modeling quantum behavior that classical supercomputers cannot.

‚ú® Understanding Earth¬†
Our new initiative, Earth AI, focuses on synthesizing disparate geospatial information and predictive models. This multi-year effort will make it possible to tackle complex planetary science and crisis resilience questions‚Äîlike precisely predicting vulnerable communities and infrastructure during an impending storm, or help in complex logistics planning‚Äîthat are currently impossible to answer due to the complexity of integrating diverse data.

The magic cycle is accelerating significantly, powered by stronger models, and agentic tools, like AI co-scientist and AI-based expert-level empirical software. And it applies across many disciplines and domains.

Today, the energy was palpable at our flagship Research@ event in Mountain View. The opportunity to advance research and AI is greater than ever and I‚Äôm excited about how AI can be an amplifier of human ingenuity.

Energized by the amazing team of Google Research and what they can do in collaboration with great colleagues and the community.

Read more in my blog: https://lnkd.in/d778XcWm

Jaclyn, an NYC-based software engineering recruiter, shared her top tips for candidates preparing for our software engineer interviews. 
Explore our open roles and opportunities ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3ZUb06f

Google Earth AI brings together our geospatial models for floods, wildfires, cyclones, air quality and much more. Today, we‚Äôre advancing its capabilities and expanding access around the globe. Learn how it can help cities, nonprofits and more with everything from environmental monitoring to disaster response ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3WRAcZL

This week, we announced a major breakthrough in quantum computing ‚Äî an algorithm called Quantum Echoes that shows the first-ever verifiable quantum advantage on hardware.

But what is quantum computing, and why does it matter? Go behind the scenes with the experts in our Quantum AI Lab to learn six fundamental principles¬†‚Üì

This week, we launched Google Skills, your new go-to platform for technical learning, from AI to data analytics to security. Whether you‚Äôre a student just getting started or an experienced developer, Google Skills features expert-led courses that get you where you want to go.

Learn more and get started today ‚Üì

Today, we‚Äôve published a new breakthrough quantum algorithm in Nature Magazine, that provides a path towards real-world quantum computing applications.

The Google Quantum AI team has successfully run an algorithm that can compute the structure of a molecule, with potential for real-world applications.

Our Willow quantum processor ran the algorithm ‚Äî which we‚Äôve named ‚ÄúQuantum Echoes‚Äù ‚Äî 13,000x faster than the best classical algorithm on one of the world‚Äôs fastest supercomputers. 

Importantly this computation is verifiable, which means its outcome can be repeated by other quantum computers or confirmed by experiments.

This is the first time in history that any quantum computer has successfully run a verifiable algorithm that surpasses the ability of classical computers. With our latest breakthrough algorithm on Willow, we‚Äôre optimistic that within five years we‚Äôll see real-world applications that are possible only on quantum computers.

Read more here: https://lnkd.in/eQ8PsFsh

Last year, we introduced Willow, our quantum chip, and cracked a key challenge in quantum error correction. Today, we announced a new breakthrough algorithm on that chip, paving the way for real-world applications. Learn more ‚Üí https://goo.gle/3L2r5mv

Google Skills is our new home for building skills in AI and other topics, like data analytics and security. It offers nearly 3,000 expert-led courses and labs, like AI foundations for students, skill-building for seasoned developers and operational AI for leaders.

In the Google Skills hub, you‚Äôll find customizable, business-aligned learning paths featuring content from Google Cloud, Google DeepMind, Grow with Google and Google for Education, all in one place.

Start learning today and see how Google Skills can advance your career, operations or organization ‚Üí skills.google.com

You‚Äôve probably heard people talking about ‚Äúvibe coding‚Äù lately ‚Äî but what actually is it? Product director Kelly Schaefer, who leads a portfolio of AI-powered products in Google Labs, explains the tools helping people build websites, apps and more ‚Äî and how they can help you at work¬†‚Üì

‚ÄúAI represents an extraordinary economic opportunity, and most signs point to labor markets continuing to thrive‚Äù ‚Äî Our chief economist Fabien Curto Millet writes in a new The Washington Post op-ed on AI‚Äôs impact on the future of work. Read more.

When I first joined Google, one of the moments that stayed with me was seeing four jazz musicians perform together after meeting for the first time. They shared their secret: internalize the fundamentals, listen closely, and support one another.

In the past, work sometimes felt more like a conductor assigning parts. At Google, it feels more like jazz, with each person contributing, adapting, and creating something better together.

In my article, I share reflections from my journey from HTC to Google Taiwan, and why now is such an exciting time to build here. Explore our open roles: https://goo.gle/tw-jobs

#LifeAtGoogle #GoogleTaiwan #JoinUs

One of the most significant opportunities for AI to benefit society is helping to accelerate cancer research and early diagnosis.

Just this week¬†our teams, working with partners, shared advances on three fronts:

Research breakthroughs: Our C2S-Scale 27B foundation model, built with Yale University and based on Gemma, is a new frontier for single-cell analysis. The tool allows researchers to quickly simulate cell responses to thousands of potential treatments, speeding up the search for new medicines. https://lnkd.in/efr4KnPX

Targeted Treatments: We're open-sourcing DeepSomatic, our new model capable of accurately differentiating actual genetic cancer variants from the technical artifacts (or errors) introduced during sequencing, addressing a critical hurdle in developing treatments. DeepSomatic successfully found hard-to-find small variants in pediatric leukemia cells that were missed by other tools. https://lnkd.in/evxkBGup

Access to screenings: Color Health, supported by Google.org funding, is launching the Color Assistant to help 20,000 women access breast cancer risk assessments and screening. Powered by Gemini 2.5 models and Vertex AI, the agent quickly determines eligibility for mammograms, schedules breast cancer screenings, and coordinates follow up. 

Excited about these developments, and look forward to further progress.
This week at Google we shared updates around our latest image generation model, Nano Banana, and introduced Veo 3.1 along with new capabilities in Flow.

What happens next? We took a photo with Lens and asked Nano Banana to generate the next 5 seconds of a scene.¬† While it‚Äôs not predicting the future in a literal sense, the model draws upon its vast world knowledge to generate a plausible outcome in each of these examples. It's a fun peek at how our latest AI image editing model can be used for creative forecasting and storytelling. 

Nano Banana is now live in Search ‚Äì accessible through Lens and AI Mode ‚Äì so you can try this out for yourself! https://lnkd.in/g687z8-K

For Esin, a Senior Account Manager on the GCS Turkiye Mid-Market team, success is built on acting as a trusted partner and advisor ‚Äî not just a seller.  ‚ÄúA common misconception is that account management is purely a sales role focused on targets,‚Äù she explains. ‚ÄúIn reality, it's deeply consultative. My primary goal is to help my clients solve complex business challenges,‚Äù like finding new customers and driving sustainable growth through Google‚Äôs latest AI-powered advertising solutions.

Her advice for those interested in similar roles? ‚ÄúTo succeed as an Account Manager, my best advice is to think like a business partner, not just a marketer,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúShow you understand how to connect marketing objectives to real business outcomes, focusing on what truly impacts your client‚Äôs bottom line.‚Äù

Want to help customers succeed in a job like Esin‚Äôs? Explore our open Account Manager roles ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4h9F320
October is Cybersecurity Awareness Month. üõ°Ô∏è Scams and fraud are everywhere, but a few small actions can keep you safer online. Learn more ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4ol4z6u

Today, Google Research announced DeepSomatic, a new machine learning model developed with our partners, including UC Santa Cruz, that accurately identifies genetic variants in cancer cells ‚Äî a critical step to help scientists and clinicians deliver more precise treatments for patients. It‚Äôs the latest breakthrough in our decade-long work applying technology and AI to genomics research. What began in 2015 as a small research effort to apply deep learning to genome sequencing challenges evolved into a global initiative spanning biodiversity, healthcare and more.

Learn more about DeepSomatic ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4n8cAe0

Take a look back at the past 10 years of our milestones in genomics ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4okgvFB
Stay one step ahead with Magic Cue on Pixel 10.

Finding time to meet just got easier with ‚ÄúHelp me schedule,‚Äù a new feature in Gmail. 

When you're responding to an email about finding a time to meet, Gmail now shows a ‚ÄúHelp me schedule‚Äù button in the toolbar. Select it, and Gemini suggests meeting times based on your availability in Google Calendar and the context of the email. Then, when the other person picks a time, a Calendar invite will be automatically created for everyone.

Carlos, a Data Center Strategic Negotiator on our Energy & Location Strategy team at Google Playa Vista, plays a crucial role in securing technical infrastructure for Google's future to meet growing customer needs across North & South America.

‚ÄúMy day to day includes leading deal negotiations and site selection across the Americas,‚Äù he explains. ‚ÄúTypically, you can find me moving from meeting to meeting to discuss location strategy and business negotiations, drafting complex contractual agreements, managing key partner relationships, and innovating with our cross-functional teams.‚Äù

Carlos‚Äô advice for aspiring Googlers? ‚ÄúBe a student of life,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not just about what you know, but how eagerly you learn what‚Äôs next.‚Äù 

Want to join Carlos on the Strategic Negotiations team? Explore our open Data Center roles today ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4iJYcYG
Waymo headed across the pond üá¨üáßWaymo is bringing its fully autonomous ride-hailing service to London in 2026. Learn more at waymo.com/london

I have always believed in the power of creativity and technology, so I am incredibly excited about our five-year partnership with WPP to bring the best of Google‚Äôs technology to WPP‚Äôs world-class creative team, and to invent the future of marketing together. 

Our teams already have a long and successful history together, and this is the latest chapter in that journey. My team has loved bringing new ideas to life with WPP Open, which now has the best of Gemini, Veo, and Imagen built in. These next generation of creative tools have incredible potential to unlock creativity and collaboration, all at the speed of AI. 

This new way of working will enable us to create truly helpful experiences for people at global scale. I am super excited to see what new kinds of campaigns and storytelling come from this partnership, and how we can continue to drive brand love and business growth in this era of AI. 

Congratulations to everyone involved at Google and WPP who made this happen. It‚Äôs a privilege to be part of the journey, and I can't wait to see what we build together.

Learn more: https://lnkd.in/gxijNj8a
From meeting notes to generating code, Googlers share how they‚Äôre using tools like Gemini and Imagen to save time, spark new ideas and build more helpful products.
Unboxing the new Pixel Watch 4 ‚Äî on shelves now.

For Hari, a Technical Solutions Engineer on the Security team, his role is about more than just code ‚Äì it‚Äôs about being a "detective, a problem-solver and a communicator." His core role is to bridge the gap between the users and the product teams. He spends his days analyzing logs, debugging code and reproducing complex technical issues to understand their root cause. Once a solution is found, he works with the product teams to get it implemented.  ‚ÄúIt's a role that's both challenging and immensely rewarding, knowing that my work directly helps our users succeed,‚Äù he says.

Hari‚Äôs secret to success at Google is a combination of curiosity, a growth mindset, empathy and collaboration. "No one at Google works in a silo,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúWe're all part of a larger ecosystem." His key piece of advice is to "Never stop learning. Your journey is yours alone, so embrace every challenge and celebrate every success along the way."

Ready to tackle complex problems and help users succeed in a role like Hari‚Äôs? Explore open opportunities for Technical Solutions Engineers ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4fmDDAh

In 2022, a small team in Google Labs had a big idea: an app that would deploy our advanced language models to help people with research, thinking and writing, all grounded in sources they had on hand. Then known as Project Tailwind, it would be released the following year as NotebookLM. Here‚Äôs how they did it, in their own words.

Introducing Google Skills, your new destination for learning everything AI and more. As AI changes everything around us, we know that the way we build new skills has to change, too. 

That‚Äôs why we created Google Skills, featuring courses ranging from AI fundamentals to operationalizing AI, along with opportunities to engage in deep AI research and hands-on labs. 

Whether you‚Äôre a student who‚Äôs new to AI or a seasoned developer, we built Google Skills for everyone. You‚Äôll get features like learning-streak rewards, gamified ways to learn, and celebrations for every milestone. 

Here‚Äôs more on what you can do with Google Skills:
üéÆ Compete in leagues and leaderboards
üß† Learn from the experts from teams at Google Cloud, Google DeepMind, Grow with Google, Google Marketing, and Google for Education
üöÄ Boost your career with new skills that stand out

It's time to close the skills gap‚Äîand have fun doing it. Sign up to receive 150 free learning credits and be the first to use Google Skills ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4qichjQ
This week, Google Cloud introduced Gemini Enterprise, which brings your work, data and people together in one AI-powered hub ‚Äî allowing you to automate entire workflows, not just tasks.

From Gemini Enterprise to the new Google Skills, here are the top announcements from #GeminiAtWork designed to transform how you work ‚û°Ô∏è

Dive into the new innovations here ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4o75oQk
Gemini Enterprise brings the best of Google AI to every employee, for every workflow, across the tools you use every day. Here are 4 ways it can help your team.
Unboxing the new Pixel 10 Pro Fold, on shelves now.

Today at #GeminiAtWork, we introduced Gemini Enterprise ‚Äî the new front door for AI in the workplace. It works across all the tools and data you use every day to make your workflows easier, giving you time back in your day. You‚Äôll be able to:

‚ú® Easily build custom AI ‚Äúagents‚Äù to handle your most tedious tasks. (No code required!)
‚ú® Connect the dots across all your business data, wherever it lives ‚Äî including Google Workspace, Microsoft 365, Salesforce and more tools you rely on.
‚ú® Automate entire workflows, not just tasks, by combining  pre-built, custom and third-party agents.

Learn more about how Gemini Enterprise can make your workflows smarter and give you time back to focus on what matters ‚Üí https://goo.gle/4mYSgfd

Tune in today at 10 PT ‚Üì

 https://lnkd.in/gDW8APDw

Today we announced a multi-year partnership with LA28 Olympic & Paralympic Games, Team USA and NBCUniversal for the LA28 Olympic and Paralympic Games. This partnership brings together the latest advancements across Google Search, Gemini and Google Cloud, and includes:

-Our products and features will be a key fixture within NBCUniversal's coverage, building on our collaboration last year with NBCUniversal and Team USA. You'll find tips on air for how you can use our latest search AI features, including AI Mode, to easily access information about the Olympic & Paralympic Games.
-Google Cloud will serve as the official cloud provider for the LA28 Games to help with everything from analyzing workouts for Team USA, to surfacing real-time insights on complex sports data, to measuring viewership in NBCUniversal‚Äôs coverage. Google Cloud will also provide LA28 with collaboration tools for planning and logistics, as it prepares to manage up to 70,000 volunteers and members of the workforce.
-We'll partner with NBCUniversal to create exclusive content for YouTube, serving as an extension of the on air coverage.

Learn more about this partnership: https://goo.gle/3ILPtIh

items.title: Teaming up with LA28, Team USA and NBCUniversal for the LA28 Olympic and Paralympic Games

text: "To lead in AI, we not only have to create the best models, we have to put them to work." ‚Äî Kent Walker writes in a new op-ed for The Hill about how getting Americans to use AI will secure U.S. leadership.
